hints.content: There are $\color{blue}30\color{black}$ apples.  We can look at $\color{green}\text{how many equal-sized groups of apples}\color{black}$  there are or $\color{maroon}\text{how many apples are in every group}}$.

### $\color{green}\text{Number of equal-sized groups}\color{black}$There are $\color{blue}30\color{black}$ total apples divided into $\color{green}5$ equal groups.[[image 0]][[image 1]][[image 2]][[image 3]][[image 4]]
$\color{blue}30\color{black}$ divided into $\color{green}5$ equal groups is $\color{blue}30\color{black}\div \color{green}5$.

### $\color{maroon}\text{Number of apples in each group}\color{black}$There are $\color{blue}30\color{black}$ apples total divided into groups of $\color{maroon}6$ apples.[[image 0]][[image 1]][[image 2]][[image 3]][[image 4]]
$\color{blue}30\color{black}$ divided into groups of $\color{maroon}6$ is $\color{blue}30\color{black}\div \color{maroon}6$.

The following expressions could represent the picture:-  $\color{blue}30\color{black}\div \color{green}5$ 
- $\color{blue}30\color{black}\div \color{maroon}6$

hints.content: There are $\color{green}12\color{black}$ eggs total.
There are $\color{blue}3\color{black}$ equal groups of eggs.

The expression $\color{green}12\color{black}\div\color{blue}3\color{black}$ will tell us how many eggs are in the basket.

question.content: There are $12$ eggs divided evenly in $3$ baskets.[[image 0]]**Which expression will tell us how many eggs are in each basket?**

- $\color{blue}32\color{black}\div \color{maroon}8$

hints.content: There are $\color{green}8\color{black}$ bananas total.
There are $\color{blue}2\color{black}$ equal bunches of bananas.

We can think of division as the following:$\color{green}\text{ Total}\color{black}\div\color{blue}\text{ Number of Groups}\color{black}$or$\color{green}\text{ Total}\color{black}\div\color{maroon}\text{ Size of the Groups}}$
The expression $\color{green}8\color{black}\div\color{blue}2\color{black}$ will tell us how many bananas are in each bunch.

question.content: [[image 0]]There are $8$ bananas divided evenly into $2$ bunches.**Which expression will tell us how many bananas are in each bunch?**

question.content: Avery plants $12$ flowers in her garden.  She plants $3$ flowers in each flower pot.  **Which image could represent this situation?**

options: [Three groups of 3 flowers. Each group of flowers has a circle around it.][[https://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/343a7f3277762fc687cda99ce135954252c508bc.svg]]
[Four groups of 3 flowers. Each group of flowers has a circle around it.][[https://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/dd20485e14d20ad39312b050e5d8f5a18b02f383.svg]]
[Four groups of 2 flowers. Each group of flowers has a circle around it.][[https://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/4fe0de9b11c135d50b87bde3d0e472571c9c98c8.svg]]
correctAnswers: [Four groups of 3 flowers. Each group of flowers has a circle around it.][[https://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/dd20485e14d20ad39312b050e5d8f5a18b02f383.svg]]

hints.content: There are $\color{blue}18\color{black}$ whales.  We can look at $\color{green}\text{how many equal-sized groups of whales}\color{black}$  there are or $\color{maroon}\text{how many whales are in every group}}$.

### $\color{green}\text{Number of equal-sized groups}\color{black}$There are $\color{blue}18\color{black}$ total whales divided into $\color{green}6$ equal groups.[[image 0]][[image 1]][[image 2]][[image 3]][[image 4]][[image 5]]
$\color{blue}18\color{black}$ divided into $\color{green}6$ equal groups is $\color{blue}18\color{black}\div \color{green}6$.

### $\color{maroon}\text{Number of whales in each group}\color{black}$There are $\color{blue}18\color{black}$ total whales divided into groups of $\color{maroon}3$ whales.[[image 0]][[image 1]][[image 2]][[image 3]][[image 4]][[image 5]]
$\color{blue}18\color{black}$ divided into groups of $\color{maroon}3$ is $\color{blue}18\color{black}\div \color{maroon}3$.

The following expressions could represent the picture:-  $\color{blue}18\color{black}\div \color{green}6$ 
- $\color{blue}18\color{black}\div \color{maroon}3$

question.content: **Which expressions could represent the picture shown below?**[[image 0]][[image 1]][[image 2]][[image 3]][[image 4]][[image 5]]

hints.content: There are $\color{blue}24\color{black}$ mice.We can look at $\color{green}\text{how many equal-sized groups of mice}\color{black}$  there are or $\color{maroon}\text{how many mice are in every group}}$.
### $\color{green}\text{Number of equal-sized groups}\color{black}$There are $\color{blue}24\color{black}$ total mice divided into $\color{green}3$ equal groups.[[image 0]][[image 1]][[image 2]]
$\color{blue}24\color{black}$ divided into $\color{green}3$ equal groups is $\color{blue}24\color{black}\div\color{green}3$.
### $\color{maroon}\text{Number of mice in each group}\color{black}$There are $\color{blue}24\color{black}$ mice total divided into groups of $\color{maroon}8$ mice.[[image 0]][[image 1]][[image 2]]
$\color{blue}24\color{black}$ divided into groups of $\color{maroon}8$ is $\color{blue}24\color{black}\div \color{maroon}8$.

The following expressions could represent the picture:-  $\color{blue}24\color{black}\div \color{green}3$ 
- $\color{blue}24\color{black}\div \color{maroon}8$
